009package imagingbook.common.math.eigen;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
015
016import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
017import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
018import imagingbook.common.math.exception.MaxIterationsExceededException;
019
020/**
021 * Eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a real matrix.
022 * This code has been ported from https://math.nist.gov/javanumerics/jama/ (Version 1.0.3), with the
023 * public API (and some internals) adapted to Apache Commons Math.
024 * Most comments below were taken from the original sources.
025 * <p>
026 * This is intended as a temporary substitute for Apache Commons Math's 
027 * implementation ({@link org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition},
028 * whose symmetry tolerance appears to be too low and thus 
029 * returns complex eigenvalues for close-to-symmetric matrices although solutions with real
030 * eigenvalues exist.
031 * </p>
032 * <p>
033 * If A is symmetric, then A = V*D*V' where the eigenvalue matrix D is diagonal
034 * and the eigenvector matrix V is orthogonal. I.e. A =
035 * V.times(D.times(V.transpose())) and V.times(V.transpose()) equals the
036 * identity matrix.
037 * </p>
038 * <p>
039 * If A is not symmetric, then the eigenvalue matrix D is block diagonal with
040 * the real eigenvalues in 1-by-1 blocks and any complex eigenvalues, lambda +
041 * i*mu, in 2-by-2 blocks, [lambda, mu; -mu, lambda]. The columns of V represent
042 * the eigenvectors in the sense that A*V = V*D, i.e. A.times(V) equals
043 * V.times(D). The matrix V may be badly conditioned, or even singular, so the
044 * validity of the equation A = V*D*inverse(V) depends upon V.cond().
045 * </p>
046 * 
047 * 
048 * @version 2022/06/19
049 */
050public class EigenDecompositionJama implements RealEigenDecomposition {
051        
052        public static final double DefaultSymmetryTolerance = 1e-12;
053        public static final double DefaultZeroTolerance = 1e-12;
054
055        private final int n;                    // row and column dimension (square matrix).
056        private final boolean issymmetric;      // symmetry flag.
057        private final double[] d;               // real parts of eigenvalues.
058        private final double[] e;               // imaginary parts of eigenvalues.
059        private final double[][] V;             // array for internal storage of eigenvectors.
060        
061        private double[][] H;                   // array for internal storage of nonsymmetric Hessenberg form.
062        private double[] ort;                   // working storage for nonsymmetric algorithm.
063        
064        private final double symmetryTol;
065        private final double zeroTol;
066
067        /**
068         * Constructor. 
069         * Checks for symmetry, then constructs the eigenvalue decomposition.
070         * 
071         * @param M matrix to be decomposed
072         * @param symmetryTol absolute threshold for determining matrix symmetry
073         * @param zeroTol absolute threshold for determining zero matrix entries
074         */
075        public EigenDecompositionJama(RealMatrix M, double symmetryTol, double zeroTol)
076                        throws MaxIterationsExceededException {
077                
078                final double[][] A = M.getData();
079                this.symmetryTol = symmetryTol;
080                this.zeroTol = zeroTol;
081                this.n = M.getColumnDimension();
082                this.V = new double[n][n];
083                this.d = new double[n];
084                this.e = new double[n];
085                
086                this.issymmetric = Matrix.isSymmetric(M, this.symmetryTol);
087
088//              issymmetric = true;
089//              for (int j = 0; (j < n) & issymmetric; j++) {
090//                      for (int i = 0; (i < n) & issymmetric; i++) {
091//                              issymmetric = (A[i][j] == A[j][i]);
092//                      }
093//              }
094
095                if (issymmetric) {
096                        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
097                                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
098                                        V[i][j] = A[i][j];
099                                }
100                        }
101                        tred2();        // Tridiagonalize.
102                        tql2();         // Diagonalize.
103
104                } else {
105                        this.H = new double[n][n];
106                        this.ort = new double[n];
107                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
108                                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
109                                        H[i][j] = A[i][j];
110                                }
111                        }
112                        orthes();       // Reduce to Hessenberg form.
113                        hqr2();         // Reduce Hessenberg to real Schur form.
114                }
115        }
116        
117        /**
118         * Constructor using default tolerance setting.
119         * See also {@link #DefaultSymmetryTolerance},  {@link #DefaultZeroTolerance}.
120         * 
121         * @param M matrix to be decomposed
122         */
123        public EigenDecompositionJama(RealMatrix M) {
124                this(M, DefaultSymmetryTolerance, DefaultZeroTolerance);
125        }
126        
127        // ------------------------ Public Methods ------------------------
128        
129        /**
130         * Returns true if the decomposed matrix is considered symmetric.
131         * See also {@link #EigenDecompositionJama(RealMatrix, double, double)},
132         * {@link #DefaultSymmetryTolerance}.
133         * 
134         * @return true if symmetric, false otherwise
135         */
136        public boolean isSymmetric() {
137                return this.issymmetric;
138        }
139
140        /**
141         * Return the matrix of eigenvectors, which are its column
142         * vectors.
143         * 
144         * @return the matrix of eigenvectors
145         */
146        @Override
147        public RealMatrix getV() {
148                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(V);
149        }
150        
151        /**
152         * Return the transpose of the eigenvector matrix.
153         * The eigenvectors are the rows of the returned matrix.
154         * 
155         * @return the transposed matrix of eigenvectors
156         */
157        public RealMatrix getVT() {
158                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(V).transpose();
159        }
160        
161         /**
162     * Returns a copy of the specified eigenvector, i.e., the
163     * associated column vector of the matrix returned
164     * by {@link #getV()}.
165     * 
166     * @param k index of the eigenvector (counting from 0).
167     * @return a copy of the k-th eigenvector
168     */
169        @Override
170    public RealVector getEigenvector(int k) {
171        double[] ev = new double[n];
172        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
173                ev[i] = V[i][k];
174        }
175        return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(ev);
176    }
177
178        /**
179         * Return the real parts of the eigenvalues
180         * @return real(diag(D))
181         */
182        @Override
183        public double[] getRealEigenvalues() {
184                return d;
185        }
186
187        /**
188         * Return the imaginary parts of the eigenvalues
189         * @return imag(diag(D))
190         */
191        public double[] getImagEigenvalues() {
192                return e;
193        }
194        
195        @Override
196        public double getRealEigenvalue(int k) {
197                return d[k];
198        }
199        
200        public double getImagEigenvalue(int k) {
201                return e[k];
202        }
203        
204        /**
205     * Returns whether the calculated eigenvalues are complex or real.
206     * The method performs a zero check on each element of the
207     * {@link #getImagEigenvalues()} array and returns {@code true} if any
208     * element is not equal to zero.
209     *
210     * @return {@code true} if any of the eigenvalues is complex, {@code false} otherwise
211     */
212        @Override
213    public boolean hasComplexEigenvalues() {
214        for (int i = 0; i < e.length; i++) {
215            if (Math.abs(e[i]) > zeroTol) {
216                return true;
217            }
218        }
219        return false;
220    }
221        
222//      /**
223//       * Return the block diagonal eigenvalue matrix
224//       * @return D
225//       */
226//      public RealMatrix getD() {
227//              final double[][] D = new double[n][n];
228//              for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
229//                      for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
230//                              D[i][j] = 0.0;
231//                      }
232//                      D[i][i] = d[i];
233//                      if (e[i] > 0) {
234//                              D[i][i + 1] = e[i];
235//                      } else if (e[i] < 0) {
236//                              D[i][i - 1] = e[i];
237//                      }
238//              }
239//              return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(D);
240//      }
241    
242    /**
243     * Gets the block diagonal matrix D of the decomposition.
244     * D is a block diagonal matrix.
245     * Real eigenvalues are on the diagonal while complex values are on
246     * 2x2 blocks {{real pos imaginary}, {neg imaginary, real}}.
247     * WB: Wonder if indexes are safe!
248     *
249         * @return D
250         */
251        @Override
252        public RealMatrix getD() {
253                RealMatrix D = MatrixUtils.createRealDiagonalMatrix(d);
254                for (int i = 0; i < e.length; i++) {
255                        if (e[i] > zeroTol) {
256                                D.setEntry(i, i + 1, e[i]);
257                        } else if (e[i] < -zeroTol) {
258                                D.setEntry(i, i - 1, e[i]);
259                        }
260                }
261                return D;
262        }
263        
264        /**
265     * Calculates and returns the determinant of the decomposed matrix.
266     *
267     * @return the determinant of the matrix.
268     */
269    public double getDeterminant() {
270        double determinant = 1.0;
271        for (double lambda : d) {
272            determinant = determinant * lambda;
273        }
274        return determinant;
275    }
276
277        // ------------------------ Private Methods ------------------------
278
279        // Symmetric Householder reduction to tridiagonal form.
280        private void tred2() {
281                // This is derived from the Algol procedures tred2 by
282                // Bowdler, Martin, Reinsch, and Wilkinson, Handbook for
283                // Auto. Comp., Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
284                // Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
285                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
286                        d[j] = V[n - 1][j];
287                }
288
289                // Householder reduction to tridiagonal form.
290                for (int i = n - 1; i > 0; i--) {
291                        // Scale to avoid under/overflow.
292                        double scale = 0.0;
293                        double h = 0.0;
294                        for (int k = 0; k < i; k++) {
295                                scale = scale + Math.abs(d[k]);
296                        }
297                        if (scale == 0.0) {
298                                e[i] = d[i - 1];
299                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
300                                        d[j] = V[i - 1][j];
301                                        V[i][j] = 0.0;
302                                        V[j][i] = 0.0;
303                                }
304                        } else {
305                                // Generate Householder vector.
306                                for (int k = 0; k < i; k++) {
307                                        d[k] /= scale;
308                                        h += d[k] * d[k];
309                                }
310                                double f = d[i - 1];
311                                double g = Math.sqrt(h);
312                                if (f > 0) {
313                                        g = -g;
314                                }
315                                e[i] = scale * g;
316                                h = h - f * g;
317                                d[i - 1] = f - g;
318                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
319                                        e[j] = 0.0;
320                                }
321
322                                // Apply similarity transformation to remaining columns.
323                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
324                                        f = d[j];
325                                        V[j][i] = f;
326                                        g = e[j] + V[j][j] * f;
327                                        for (int k = j + 1; k <= i - 1; k++) {
328                                                g += V[k][j] * d[k];
329                                                e[k] += V[k][j] * f;
330                                        }
331                                        e[j] = g;
332                                }
333                                f = 0.0;
334                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
335                                        e[j] /= h;
336                                        f += e[j] * d[j];
337                                }
338                                final double hh = f / (h + h);
339                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
340                                        e[j] -= hh * d[j];
341                                }
342                                for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) {
343                                        f = d[j];
344                                        g = e[j];
345                                        for (int k = j; k <= i - 1; k++) {
346                                                V[k][j] -= (f * e[k] + g * d[k]);
347                                        }
348                                        d[j] = V[i - 1][j];
349                                        V[i][j] = 0.0;
350                                }
351                        }
352                        d[i] = h;
353                }
354
355                // Accumulate transformations.
356                for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; i++) {
357                        V[n - 1][i] = V[i][i];
358                        V[i][i] = 1.0;
359                        final double h = d[i + 1];
360                        if (h != 0.0) {
361                                for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
362                                        d[k] = V[k][i + 1] / h;
363                                }
364                                for (int j = 0; j <= i; j++) {
365                                        double g = 0.0;
366                                        for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
367                                                g += V[k][i + 1] * V[k][j];
368                                        }
369                                        for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
370                                                V[k][j] -= g * d[k];
371                                        }
372                                }
373                        }
374                        for (int k = 0; k <= i; k++) {
375                                V[k][i + 1] = 0.0;
376                        }
377                }
378                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
379                        d[j] = V[n - 1][j];
380                        V[n - 1][j] = 0.0;
381                }
382                V[n - 1][n - 1] = 1.0;
383                e[0] = 0.0;
384        }
385
386        // Symmetric tridiagonal QL algorithm.
387        private void tql2() {
388                // This is derived from the Algol procedures tql2, by
389                // Bowdler, Martin, Reinsch, and Wilkinson, Handbook for
390                // Auto. Comp., Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
391                // Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
392                for (int i = 1; i < n; i++) {
393                        e[i - 1] = e[i];
394                }
395                e[n - 1] = 0.0;
396
397                double f = 0.0;
398                double tst1 = 0.0;
399                final double eps = Math.pow(2.0, -52.0);
400                for (int l = 0; l < n; l++) {
401                        // Find small subdiagonal element
402                        tst1 = Math.max(tst1, Math.abs(d[l]) + Math.abs(e[l]));
403                        int m = l;
404                        while (m < n) {
405                                if (Math.abs(e[m]) <= eps * tst1) {
406                                        break;
407                                }
408                                m++;
409                        }
410
411                        // If m == l, d[l] is an eigenvalue,
412                        // otherwise, iterate.
413                        if (m > l) {
414                                int iter = 0;
415                                do {
416                                        iter = iter + 1; // (Could check iteration count here.)
417                                        // Compute implicit shift
418                                        double g = d[l];
419                                        double p = (d[l + 1] - g) / (2.0 * e[l]);
420                                        double r = Math.hypot(p, 1.0);
421                                        if (p < 0) {
422                                                r = -r;
423                                        }
424                                        d[l] = e[l] / (p + r);
425                                        d[l + 1] = e[l] * (p + r);
426                                        final double dl1 = d[l + 1];
427                                        double h = g - d[l];
428                                        for (int i = l + 2; i < n; i++) {
429                                                d[i] -= h;
430                                        }
431                                        f = f + h;
432
433                                        // Implicit QL transformation.
434                                        p = d[m];
435                                        double c = 1.0;
436                                        double c2 = c;
437                                        double c3 = c;
438                                        final double el1 = e[l + 1];
439                                        double s = 0.0;
440                                        double s2 = 0.0;
441                                        for (int i = m - 1; i >= l; i--) {
442                                                c3 = c2;
443                                                c2 = c;
444                                                s2 = s;
445                                                g = c * e[i];
446                                                h = c * p;
447                                                r = Math.hypot(p, e[i]);
448                                                e[i + 1] = s * r;
449                                                s = e[i] / r;
450                                                c = p / r;
451                                                p = c * d[i] - s * g;
452                                                d[i + 1] = h + s * (c * g + s * d[i]);
453
454                                                // Accumulate transformation.
455                                                for (int k = 0; k < n; k++) {
456                                                        h = V[k][i + 1];
457                                                        V[k][i + 1] = s * V[k][i] + c * h;
458                                                        V[k][i] = c * V[k][i] - s * h;
459                                                }
460                                        }
461                                        p = -s * s2 * c3 * el1 * e[l] / dl1;
462                                        e[l] = s * p;
463                                        d[l] = c * p;
464
465                                        // Check for convergence.
466                                } while (Math.abs(e[l]) > eps * tst1);
467                        }
468                        d[l] = d[l] + f;
469                        e[l] = 0.0;
470                }
471
472                // Sort eigenvalues and corresponding vectors.
473                for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; i++) {
474                        int k = i;
475                        double p = d[i];
476                        for (int j = i + 1; j < n; j++) {
477                                if (d[j] < p) {
478                                        k = j;
479                                        p = d[j];
480                                }
481                        }
482                        if (k != i) {
483                                d[k] = d[i];
484                                d[i] = p;
485                                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
486                                        p = V[j][i];
487                                        V[j][i] = V[j][k];
488                                        V[j][k] = p;
489                                }
490                        }
491                }
492        }
493
494        // Nonsymmetric reduction to Hessenberg form.
495        private void orthes() {
496                // This is derived from the Algol procedures orthes and ortran,
497                // by Martin and Wilkinson, Handbook for Auto. Comp.,
498                // Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
499                // Fortran subroutines in EISPACK.
500                final int low = 0;
501                final int high = n - 1;
502                
503                for (int m = low + 1; m <= high - 1; m++) {
504
505                        // Scale column.
506
507                        double scale = 0.0;
508                        for (int i = m; i <= high; i++) {
509                                scale = scale + Math.abs(H[i][m - 1]);
510                        }
511                        if (scale != 0.0) {
512                                // Compute Householder transformation.
513                                double h = 0.0;
514                                for (int i = high; i >= m; i--) {
515                                        ort[i] = H[i][m - 1] / scale;
516                                        h += ort[i] * ort[i];
517                                }
518                                double g = Math.sqrt(h);
519                                if (ort[m] > 0) {
520                                        g = -g;
521                                }
522                                h = h - ort[m] * g;
523                                ort[m] = ort[m] - g;
524
525                                // Apply Householder similarity transformation
526                                // H = (I-u*u'/h)*H*(I-u*u')/h)
527                                for (int j = m; j < n; j++) {
528                                        double f = 0.0;
529                                        for (int i = high; i >= m; i--) {
530                                                f += ort[i] * H[i][j];
531                                        }
532                                        f = f / h;
533                                        for (int i = m; i <= high; i++) {
534                                                H[i][j] -= f * ort[i];
535                                        }
536                                }
537
538                                for (int i = 0; i <= high; i++) {
539                                        double f = 0.0;
540                                        for (int j = high; j >= m; j--) {
541                                                f += ort[j] * H[i][j];
542                                        }
543                                        f = f / h;
544                                        for (int j = m; j <= high; j++) {
545                                                H[i][j] -= f * ort[j];
546                                        }
547                                }
548                                ort[m] = scale * ort[m];
549                                H[m][m - 1] = scale * g;
550                        }
551                }
552
553                // Accumulate transformations (Algol's ortran).
554                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
555                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
556                                V[i][j] = (i == j ? 1.0 : 0.0);
557                        }
558                }
559
560                for (int m = high - 1; m >= low + 1; m--) {
561                        if (H[m][m - 1] != 0.0) {
562                                for (int i = m + 1; i <= high; i++) {
563                                        ort[i] = H[i][m - 1];
564                                }
565                                for (int j = m; j <= high; j++) {
566                                        double g = 0.0;
567                                        for (int i = m; i <= high; i++) {
568                                                g += ort[i] * V[i][j];
569                                        }
570                                        // Double division avoids possible underflow
571                                        g = (g / ort[m]) / H[m][m - 1];
572                                        for (int i = m; i <= high; i++) {
573                                                V[i][j] += g * ort[i];
574                                        }
575                                }
576                        }
577                }
578        }
579
580//      // Complex scalar division (old)
581//      private transient double cdivr, cdivi;
582//
583//      @Deprecated
584//      private void cdivOld(final double xr, final double xi, final double yr, final double yi) {
585//              double r, d;
586//              if (Math.abs(yr) > Math.abs(yi)) {
587//                      r = yi / yr;
588//                      d = yr + r * yi;
589//                      cdivr = (xr + r * xi) / d;
590//                      cdivi = (xi - r * xr) / d;
591//              } else {
592//                      r = yr / yi;
593//                      d = yi + r * yr;
594//                      cdivr = (r * xr + xi) / d;
595//                      cdivi = (r * xi - xr) / d;
596//              }
597//      }
598        
599    /**
600     * Performs a division of two complex numbers.
601     *
602     * @param xr real part of the first number
603     * @param xi imaginary part of the first number
604     * @param yr real part of the second number
605     * @param yi imaginary part of the second number
606     * @return result of the complex division
607     */
608    private Complex cdiv(final double xr, final double xi,
609                         final double yr, final double yi) {
610        return new Complex(xr, xi).divide(new Complex(yr, yi));
611    }
612
613        // Nonsymmetric reduction from Hessenberg to real Schur form.
614        private void hqr2() {
615                // This is derived from the Algol procedure hqr2,
616                // by Martin and Wilkinson, Handbook for Auto. Comp.,
617                // Vol.ii-Linear Algebra, and the corresponding
618                // Fortran subroutine in EISPACK.
619                
620                // Initialize
621                final int nn = this.n;
622                int n = nn - 1;
623                final int low = 0;
624                final int high = nn - 1;
625                final double eps = Math.pow(2.0, -52.0);
626                double exshift = 0.0;
627                double p = 0, q = 0, r = 0, s = 0, z = 0, t, w, x, y;
628
629                // Store roots isolated by balanc and compute matrix norm
630                double norm = 0.0;
631                for (int i = 0; i < nn; i++) {
632                        if (i < low | i > high) {
633                                d[i] = H[i][i];
634                                e[i] = 0.0;
635                        }
636                        for (int j = Math.max(i - 1, 0); j < nn; j++) {
637                                norm = norm + Math.abs(H[i][j]);
638                        }
639                }
640
641                // Outer loop over eigenvalue index
642                int iter = 0;
643                while (n >= low) {
644                        // Look for single small sub-diagonal element
645                        int l = n;
646                        while (l > low) {
647                                s = Math.abs(H[l - 1][l - 1]) + Math.abs(H[l][l]);
648                                if (s == 0.0) {
649                                        s = norm;
650                                }
651                                if (Math.abs(H[l][l - 1]) < eps * s) {
652                                        break;
653                                }
654                                l--;
655                        }
656
657                        // Check for convergence
658                        // One root found
659                        if (l == n) {
660                                H[n][n] = H[n][n] + exshift;
661                                d[n] = H[n][n];
662                                e[n] = 0.0;
663                                n--;
664                                iter = 0;
665                                // Two roots found
666                        } else if (l == n - 1) {
667                                w = H[n][n - 1] * H[n - 1][n];
668                                p = (H[n - 1][n - 1] - H[n][n]) / 2.0;
669                                q = p * p + w;
670                                z = Math.sqrt(Math.abs(q));
671                                H[n][n] = H[n][n] + exshift;
672                                H[n - 1][n - 1] = H[n - 1][n - 1] + exshift;
673                                x = H[n][n];
674
675                                // Real pair
676                                if (q >= 0) {
677                                        if (p >= 0) {
678                                                z = p + z;
679                                        } else {
680                                                z = p - z;
681                                        }
682                                        d[n - 1] = x + z;
683                                        d[n] = d[n - 1];
684                                        if (z != 0.0) {
685                                                d[n] = x - w / z;
686                                        }
687                                        e[n - 1] = 0.0;
688                                        e[n] = 0.0;
689                                        x = H[n][n - 1];
690                                        s = Math.abs(x) + Math.abs(z);
691                                        p = x / s;
692                                        q = z / s;
693                                        r = Math.sqrt(p * p + q * q);
694                                        p = p / r;
695                                        q = q / r;
696
697                                        // Row modification
698                                        for (int j = n - 1; j < nn; j++) {
699                                                z = H[n - 1][j];
700                                                H[n - 1][j] = q * z + p * H[n][j];
701                                                H[n][j] = q * H[n][j] - p * z;
702                                        }
703
704                                        // Column modification
705                                        for (int i = 0; i <= n; i++) {
706                                                z = H[i][n - 1];
707                                                H[i][n - 1] = q * z + p * H[i][n];
708                                                H[i][n] = q * H[i][n] - p * z;
709                                        }
710
711                                        // Accumulate transformations
712                                        for (int i = low; i <= high; i++) {
713                                                z = V[i][n - 1];
714                                                V[i][n - 1] = q * z + p * V[i][n];
715                                                V[i][n] = q * V[i][n] - p * z;
716                                        }
717
718                                        // Complex pair
719                                } else {
720                                        d[n - 1] = x + p;
721                                        d[n] = x + p;
722                                        e[n - 1] = z;
723                                        e[n] = -z;
724                                }
725                                n = n - 2;
726                                iter = 0;
727                                // No convergence yet
728                        } else {
729                                // Form shift
730                                x = H[n][n];
731                                y = 0.0;
732                                w = 0.0;
733                                if (l < n) {
734                                        y = H[n - 1][n - 1];
735                                        w = H[n][n - 1] * H[n - 1][n];
736                                }
737
738                                // Wilkinson's original ad hoc shift
739                                if (iter == 10) {
740                                        exshift += x;
741                                        for (int i = low; i <= n; i++) {
742                                                H[i][i] -= x;
743                                        }
744                                        s = Math.abs(H[n][n - 1]) + Math.abs(H[n - 1][n - 2]);
745                                        x = y = 0.75 * s;
746                                        w = -0.4375 * s * s;
747                                }
748
749                                // MATLAB's new ad hoc shift
750                                if (iter == 30) {
751                                        s = (y - x) / 2.0;
752                                        s = s * s + w;
753                                        if (s > 0) {
754                                                s = Math.sqrt(s);
755                                                if (y < x) {
756                                                        s = -s;
757                                                }
758                                                s = x - w / ((y - x) / 2.0 + s);
759                                                for (int i = low; i <= n; i++) {
760                                                        H[i][i] -= s;
761                                                }
762                                                exshift += s;
763                                                x = y = w = 0.964;
764                                        }
765                                }
766
767                                iter = iter + 1; // (Could check iteration count here.)
768                                if (iter > 30) {
769                                        throw new MaxIterationsExceededException(30);   // wilbur added as safeguard
770                                }
771
772                                // Look for two consecutive small sub-diagonal elements
773                                int m = n - 2;
774                                while (m >= l) {
775                                        z = H[m][m];
776                                        r = x - z;
777                                        s = y - z;
778                                        p = (r * s - w) / H[m + 1][m] + H[m][m + 1];
779                                        q = H[m + 1][m + 1] - z - r - s;
780                                        r = H[m + 2][m + 1];
781                                        s = Math.abs(p) + Math.abs(q) + Math.abs(r);
782                                        p = p / s;
783                                        q = q / s;
784                                        r = r / s;
785                                        if (m == l) {
786                                                break;
787                                        }
788                                        if (Math.abs(H[m][m - 1]) * (Math.abs(q) + Math.abs(r)) < eps
789                                                        * (Math.abs(p) * (Math.abs(H[m - 1][m - 1]) + Math.abs(z) + Math.abs(H[m + 1][m + 1])))) {
790                                                break;
791                                        }
792                                        m--;
793                                }
794
795                                for (int i = m + 2; i <= n; i++) {
796                                        H[i][i - 2] = 0.0;
797                                        if (i > m + 2) {
798                                                H[i][i - 3] = 0.0;
799                                        }
800                                }
801
802                                // Double QR step involving rows l:n and columns m:n
803                                for (int k = m; k <= n - 1; k++) {
804                                        final boolean notlast = (k != n - 1);
805                                        if (k != m) {
806                                                p = H[k][k - 1];
807                                                q = H[k + 1][k - 1];
808                                                r = (notlast ? H[k + 2][k - 1] : 0.0);
809                                                x = Math.abs(p) + Math.abs(q) + Math.abs(r);
810                                                if (x != 0.0) {
811                                                        p = p / x;
812                                                        q = q / x;
813                                                        r = r / x;
814                                                }
815                                        }
816                                        if (x == 0.0) {
817                                                break;
818                                        }
819                                        s = Math.sqrt(p * p + q * q + r * r);
820                                        if (p < 0) {
821                                                s = -s;
822                                        }
823                                        if (s != 0) {
824                                                if (k != m) {
825                                                        H[k][k - 1] = -s * x;
826                                                } else if (l != m) {
827                                                        H[k][k - 1] = -H[k][k - 1];
828                                                }
829                                                p = p + s;
830                                                x = p / s;
831                                                y = q / s;
832                                                z = r / s;
833                                                q = q / p;
834                                                r = r / p;
835
836                                                // Row modification
837
838                                                for (int j = k; j < nn; j++) {
839                                                        p = H[k][j] + q * H[k + 1][j];
840                                                        if (notlast) {
841                                                                p = p + r * H[k + 2][j];
842                                                                H[k + 2][j] = H[k + 2][j] - p * z;
843                                                        }
844                                                        H[k][j] = H[k][j] - p * x;
845                                                        H[k + 1][j] = H[k + 1][j] - p * y;
846                                                }
847
848                                                // Column modification
849
850                                                for (int i = 0; i <= Math.min(n, k + 3); i++) {
851                                                        p = x * H[i][k] + y * H[i][k + 1];
852                                                        if (notlast) {
853                                                                p = p + z * H[i][k + 2];
854                                                                H[i][k + 2] = H[i][k + 2] - p * r;
855                                                        }
856                                                        H[i][k] = H[i][k] - p;
857                                                        H[i][k + 1] = H[i][k + 1] - p * q;
858                                                }
859
860                                                // Accumulate transformations
861
862                                                for (int i = low; i <= high; i++) {
863                                                        p = x * V[i][k] + y * V[i][k + 1];
864                                                        if (notlast) {
865                                                                p = p + z * V[i][k + 2];
866                                                                V[i][k + 2] = V[i][k + 2] - p * r;
867                                                        }
868                                                        V[i][k] = V[i][k] - p;
869                                                        V[i][k + 1] = V[i][k + 1] - p * q;
870                                                }
871                                        } // (s != 0)
872                                } // k loop
873                        } // check convergence
874                } // while (n >= low)
875
876                // Backsubstitute to find vectors of upper triangular form
877
878                if (norm == 0.0) {
879                        return;
880                }
881
882                for (n = nn - 1; n >= 0; n--) {
883                        p = d[n];
884                        q = e[n];
885
886                        // Real vector
887                        if (q == 0) {
888                                int l = n;
889                                H[n][n] = 1.0;
890                                for (int i = n - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
891                                        w = H[i][i] - p;
892                                        r = 0.0;
893                                        for (int j = l; j <= n; j++) {
894                                                r = r + H[i][j] * H[j][n];
895                                        }
896                                        if (e[i] < 0.0) {
897                                                z = w;
898                                                s = r;
899                                        } else {
900                                                l = i;
901                                                if (e[i] == 0.0) {
902                                                        if (w != 0.0) {
903                                                                H[i][n] = -r / w;
904                                                        } else {
905                                                                H[i][n] = -r / (eps * norm);
906                                                        }
907
908                                                        // Solve real equations
909
910                                                } else {
911                                                        x = H[i][i + 1];
912                                                        y = H[i + 1][i];
913                                                        q = (d[i] - p) * (d[i] - p) + e[i] * e[i];
914                                                        t = (x * s - z * r) / q;
915                                                        H[i][n] = t;
916                                                        if (Math.abs(x) > Math.abs(z)) {
917                                                                H[i + 1][n] = (-r - w * t) / x;
918                                                        } else {
919                                                                H[i + 1][n] = (-s - y * t) / z;
920                                                        }
921                                                }
922
923                                                // Overflow control
924
925                                                t = Math.abs(H[i][n]);
926                                                if ((eps * t) * t > 1) {
927                                                        for (int j = i; j <= n; j++) {
928                                                                H[j][n] = H[j][n] / t;
929                                                        }
930                                                }
931                                        }
932                                }
933                                // Complex vector
934                        } else if (q < 0) {
935                                int l = n - 1;
936                                // Last vector component imaginary so matrix is triangular
937                                if (Math.abs(H[n][n - 1]) > Math.abs(H[n - 1][n])) {
938                                        H[n - 1][n - 1] = q / H[n][n - 1];
939                                        H[n - 1][n] = -(H[n][n] - p) / H[n][n - 1];
940                                } else {
941//                                      cdiv(0.0, -H[n - 1][n], H[n - 1][n - 1] - p, q);
942                                        Complex cpx = cdiv(0.0, -H[n - 1][n], H[n - 1][n - 1] - p, q);
943                                        H[n - 1][n - 1] = cpx.getReal();        //cdivr;
944                                        H[n - 1][n] = cpx.getImaginary();               //cdivi;
945                                }
946                                H[n][n - 1] = 0.0;
947                                H[n][n] = 1.0;
948                                for (int i = n - 2; i >= 0; i--) {
949                                        double ra, sa, vr, vi;
950                                        ra = 0.0;
951                                        sa = 0.0;
952                                        for (int j = l; j <= n; j++) {
953                                                ra = ra + H[i][j] * H[j][n - 1];
954                                                sa = sa + H[i][j] * H[j][n];
955                                        }
956                                        w = H[i][i] - p;
957
958                                        if (e[i] < 0.0) {
959                                                z = w;
960                                                r = ra;
961                                                s = sa;
962                                        } else {
963                                                l = i;
964                                                if (e[i] == 0) {
965                                                        // cdiv(-ra, -sa, w, q);
966                                                        Complex cpx = cdiv(-ra, -sa, w, q);
967                                                        H[i][n - 1] = cpx.getReal();    //cdivr;
968                                                        H[i][n] = cpx.getImaginary();   //cdivi;
969                                                } else {
970
971                                                        // Solve complex equations
972
973                                                        x = H[i][i + 1];
974                                                        y = H[i + 1][i];
975                                                        vr = (d[i] - p) * (d[i] - p) + e[i] * e[i] - q * q;
976                                                        vi = (d[i] - p) * 2.0 * q;
977                                                        if (vr == 0.0 & vi == 0.0) {
978                                                                vr = eps * norm * (Math.abs(w) + Math.abs(q) + Math.abs(x) + Math.abs(y) + Math.abs(z));
979                                                        }
980//                                                      cdiv(x * r - z * ra + q * sa, x * s - z * sa - q * ra, vr, vi);
981                                                        Complex cpx1 = cdiv(x * r - z * ra + q * sa, x * s - z * sa - q * ra, vr, vi);
982                                                        H[i][n - 1] = cpx1.getReal();   //cdivr;
983                                                        H[i][n] = cpx1.getImaginary();  //cdivi;
984                                                        if (Math.abs(x) > (Math.abs(z) + Math.abs(q))) {
985                                                                H[i + 1][n - 1] = (-ra - w * H[i][n - 1] + q * H[i][n]) / x;
986                                                                H[i + 1][n] = (-sa - w * H[i][n] - q * H[i][n - 1]) / x;
987                                                        } else {
988//                                                              cdiv(-r - y * H[i][n - 1], -s - y * H[i][n], z, q);
989                                                                Complex cpx2 = cdiv(-r - y * H[i][n - 1], -s - y * H[i][n], z, q);
990                                                                H[i + 1][n - 1] = cpx2.getReal();       //cdivr;
991                                                                H[i + 1][n] = cpx2.getImaginary();      //cdivi;
992                                                        }
993                                                }
994
995                                                // Overflow control
996
997                                                t = Math.max(Math.abs(H[i][n - 1]), Math.abs(H[i][n]));
998                                                if ((eps * t) * t > 1) {
999                                                        for (int j = i; j <= n; j++) {
1000                                                                H[j][n - 1] = H[j][n - 1] / t;
1001                                                                H[j][n] = H[j][n] / t;
1002                                                        }
1003                                                }
1004                                        }
1005                                }
1006                        }
1007                }
1008
1009                // Vectors of isolated roots
1010                for (int i = 0; i < nn; i++) {
1011                        if (i < low | i > high) {
1012                                for (int j = i; j < nn; j++) {
1013                                        V[i][j] = H[i][j];
1014                                }
1015                        }
1016                }
1017
1018                // Back transformation to get eigenvectors of original matrix
1019                for (int j = nn - 1; j >= low; j--) {
1020                        for (int i = low; i <= high; i++) {
1021                                z = 0.0;
1022                                for (int k = low; k <= Math.min(j, high); k++) {
1023                                        z = z + V[i][k] * H[k][j];
1024                                }
1025                                V[i][j] = z;
1026                        }
1027                }
1028        }
1029        
1030        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1031        
1032        public static void main(String[] args) {
1033                
1034                // 2 examples where Apache's implementation fails:
1035                
1036                // non-symmetric example:
1037//              RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]  
1038//                      {{4455707.000000000, 16685.500000000, 17344.500000000, 142.000000000}, 
1039//                      {-951005821.436619800, -3525507.007042253, -4059917.288732395, -33371.000000000}, 
1040//                      {-997789920.901407700, -4059917.288732392, -3879630.838028166, -34689.000000000}, 
1041//                      {70029373562.509700000, 297685588.322852130, 314485277.997519970, 2949430.845070420}});
1042                
1043                // symmetric example:
1044                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]
1045                        {{-635322.712034708800000, 4756.174679968795000, -265184.797553499500000, 20382.684252847448000}, 
1046                        {4756.174679968796000, 560670.646574945200000, 0.190328961575323, -0.016193729208773}, 
1047                        {-265184.797553499500000, 0.190328961575416, 74652.065423977560000, 1.470729864949432}, 
1048                        {20382.684252847444000, -0.016193729208773, 1.470729864949432, 0.000035786438260}});
1049                
1050                // singular matrix
1051//              RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]
1052//                              {{2, 1, 0},
1053//                              {0, 2, 0},
1054//                              {0, 0, 0}});
1055                
1056                // singular matrix
1057//                              RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]
1058//                                              {{2, 1, 4, -1},
1059//                                              {3, -2, 1, 0},
1060//                                              {5, 1, -3, 2},
1061//                                              {-1, 3, 3, -1}});
1062                
1063                PrintPrecision.set(9);
1064                
1065                System.out.println("det(M) = " + Matrix.determinant(M));
1066                System.out.println("symmetric(M) = " + MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(M, 1e-12));
1067                System.out.println("singular(M) = " + Matrix.isSingular(M));
1068                
1069                {
1070                        System.out.println("\nJAMA: *****************************");
1071                        EigenDecompositionJama ed = new EigenDecompositionJama(M);
1072                        System.out.println("evalsRe = " + Matrix.toString(ed.getRealEigenvalues()));
1073                        System.out.println("evalsIm = " + Matrix.toString(ed.getImagEigenvalues()));
1074                        System.out.println("has complex evs = " + ed.hasComplexEigenvalues());
1075                        System.out.println("D = \n" + Matrix.toString(ed.getD()));
1076                        System.out.println("V = \n" + Matrix.toString(ed.getV()));
1077                }
1078                
1079                {
1080                        System.out.println("\nApache Commons Math: *****************************");
1081                        org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition  ed = 
1082                                        new org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition(M);
1083                        System.out.println("evalsRe = " + Matrix.toString(ed.getRealEigenvalues()));
1084                        System.out.println("evalsIm = " + Matrix.toString(ed.getImagEigenvalues()));
1085                        System.out.println("has complex evs = " + ed.hasComplexEigenvalues());
1086                        System.out.println("D = \n" + Matrix.toString(ed.getD()));
1087                        System.out.println("V = \n" + Matrix.toString(ed.getV()));
1088                }
1089        }
1090        
1091        
1092}
